Quiz.question:
1 Part II: Executing the Response Select the appropriate answer, then click Done. The first task you're having your team perform this morning is taking samples in the SeaBee compound using your RADeCO.

The RADeCOs were initially calibrated at 70ºF and 760 mmHg. The current outside temperature is 110ºF.

You don't have the equipment available to recalibrate the RADeCOs. Do you need to consider temperature correction when calculating your total volume sampled? Yes, because the temperature difference varies by 40ºF No, because the temperature difference is not greater than 50ºF 1
